definition: without viscosity, not very dense, to take off weight
details:
adverb
- without viscosity
= example: without viscosity
= synonyms: thinly
adjective
- not very dense
= example: not very dense
= synonyms: sparse
- lacking excess flesh
= example: lacking excess flesh
= synonyms: lean
- of sound, lacking resonance or volume
= example: of sound, lacking resonance or volume
- lacking substance or significance
= example: lacking substance or significance
= synonyms: flimsy, fragile, slight, tenuous
- lacking spirit or sincere effort
= example: lacking spirit or sincere effort
- of relatively small extent from one surface to the opposite or in cross section
= example: of relatively small extent from one surface to the opposite or in cross section
- relatively thin in consistency or low in density
= example: relatively thin in consistency or low in density
- very narrow
= example: very narrow
= synonyms: slender
verb
- to take off weight
= example: to take off weight
= synonyms: slim, reduce, melt off, lose weight, slenderise, slenderize, slim down
- to lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
= example: to lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
= synonyms: cut, dilute, reduce, thin out
- to make thin or thinner
= example: to make thin or thinner
- to lose thickness
= example: to lose thickness
